climbs.name: Beefwhale
climbs.fa: D Brayshaw A Cairns 1996 (possibly previously by J Chilton 1992)

content.description:
An apparently wide crack, but few true wide crack skills are needed because of plentiful face holds. Start at a single bolt belay on the ledge. Climb a left-facing corner that leans back to become a right-trending ramp. Near the top of the ramp, pull a small roof and move left on a ledge to gain a diagonal offwidth. Laybacky underclingy moves with face holds out left lead to a vertical chimney type feature with finger and hand cracks in the back and good stemming, and eventually the anchor.

Chain station; 50m rappel back to the base or hike up across the ledge on top to This Is Your Brain and climb a route there.
Full rack from small-med wire nuts up to #4 Camalot.

This possible two-pitch route is on the right side of the Speedway, just left of a massive mossy fault. Begin at a two-bolt station on the approach ledge and climb a 25m, right-diagonaling finger and hand crack (trad pro) to a small platform ledge and bolt belay next to the mossy fault. Step right from the bolt belay onto the open face and climb past 7? bolts to the top. Can be done as two 25 pitches or linked up into one long 50m pitch.

Right side of Speedway wall. Bolt stations but no chains; rap Beefwhale or walk off down the This is Your Brain approach trail.
Finger-hand size nuts and cams (up to #2 Camalot)and quickdraws.
Large, low crag facing the highway, below This Is Your Brain and north of Stump Wall. Adventurous, rarely climbed trad routes with highway noise and lots of potential for additional sport climbing.
